page.title: 16FARMING IN LECHLADE
page.content: { Manor Farm}covers 230 acres and has a small dairy herd and some arable land. Milk is collected daily and taken to Oxford. The main crops are oats, barley and wheat. Calves are sold at Chippenham or Banbury Markets and corn is sold to a merchant for feed or seed. Some barley is used for malting.{Leaze Farm}has 250 friesian cows which produce 5000 litres of milk daily which is collected by a Milk Marketing Board tanker. Twenty cows are milked at one time in a herringbone parlour. The only crop grown is maize for the cows to eat and the grass is cut for silage. Ponies are bred here too.{Rough Grounds Farm fattens pigs and cattle which are sold to abattoirs. Wheat and barley are grown for feed stock and potatoes are sold locally.{Paradise Farm}has dairy produce,cereals, potatoes and pigs.
